writing_prompts.title: Prized possession
writing_prompts.prompt: Describe an item you were incredibly attached to as a child. What became of it?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Escape!
writing_prompts.prompt: Describe your ultimate escape plan, and where you're escaping from.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: The transporter
writing_prompts.prompt: Tell us about about a sensation-a taste, a smell, a piece of music-that transports you back to childhood.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Share the love
writing_prompts.prompt: Tell us about another blogger who has influenced your own online journey.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Third from the top
writing_prompts.prompt: Head to your favorite blog. Scroll down to the third post in the list. Take the third sentence in the post, and work it into a new post of your own.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Alma mater
writing_prompts.prompt: You've been asked to speak at your high school alma mater about the path of life. Draft the speech.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Turn, turn, turn
writing_prompts.prompt: For many of us, winter ins blooming into spring, or fall hardening into winter. Which season do you look most forward to?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Do-over
writing_prompts.prompt: Go back to a blog post you always though could be better, or were unsatisifed with-now, fix it.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Imperfection
writing_prompts.prompt: Imperfections-in things, in people, in places-add character to life. Tell us about an imperfection that you cherish.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Press it.
writing_prompts.prompt: Give some love to three blog posts you've read and loved in the past week, and tell us why they're worth reading.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Decisions, decisions.
writing_prompts.prompt: How are you more likely to make an important decision: by reasoning through it, or by goign with your gut?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Charitable.
writing_prompts.prompt: You've ineherited $5 million, with instructions taht you must give it all away, but you can choose any organization your like to be the beneficiaries. Where does the money go?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: S/he said.
writing_prompts.prompt: Pause whatever you’re doing, and ask the person nearest you what they’re thinking about (call someone if you have to). Write a post based on it.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: The satisfaction of a list.
writing_prompts.prompt: Who doesn’t love a list? So write one! Top five slices of pizza in your town, ten reasons disco will never die, the three secrets to happiness — go silly or go deep, just go list-y.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: History of language
writing_prompts.prompt: Write a piece of fiction describing the incident that gave rise to the phrase, “third time’s the charm.”
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Million-dollar question
writing_prompts.prompt: Why do you blog?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Unknown caller
writing_prompts.prompt: You receive a call from an unexpected person. Who is it, and what is the conversation about? Go!
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Freaky Friday
writing_prompts.prompt: If you could be someone else for a day, who would you be, and why? If that seems too easy, try this one: who would you like to have spend a day as you and what do you hope they’d learn from the experience?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: The bizarro world
writing_prompts.prompt: In the DC comics universe, a planet called “Htrae” (“Earth” spelled backwards) is populated with bizarre versions of superheroes. A Seinfeld episode made the idea of this Bizarro World popular, where the characters encountered their opposite selves. Craft a scene in which you meet an opposite version of yourself — or a story in a bizarre, back- wards world.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Companionable
writing_prompts.prompt: Head to one of your favorite blogs. Write a companion piece to their penultimate post.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Critical eye
writing_prompts.prompt: Write about the subject you usually blog about as if you were a music critic.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Earworm
writing_prompts.prompt: What song is stuck in your head (or on permanent rotation in your CD or MP3 player) these days? Why does it speak to you?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Stranger
writing_prompts.prompt: Have you ever had a random encounter or fleeting moment with a stranger that stuck with you?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Clone wars
writing_prompts.prompt: If you could clone yourself, how would you split up your responsibilities?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Second time around
writing_prompts.prompt: Tell us about a book you can read again and again without getting bored — what is it that speaks to you?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Wall to wall
writing_prompts.prompt: What do you display on the walls of your home — photos, posters, artwork, nothing? How do you choose what to dis- play? What mood are you trying to create?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Your time to shine
writing_prompts.prompt: Early bird, or night owl?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Cringe-worthy
writing_prompts.prompt: Do you feel uncomfortable when you see someone else being embarrassed? What’s most likely to make you squirm?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Art appreciation
writing_prompts.prompt: Do you need to agree with an artist’s lifestyle or politics to appreciate their art? To spend money on it?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Personal space
writing_prompts.prompt: To what extent is your blog a place for your own self- expression and creativity vs. a site designed to attract read- ers? How do you balance that? If sticking to certain topics and types of posts meant your readership would triple, would you do it?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Mad Libs
writing_prompts.prompt: Turn to your co-workers, kids, Facebook friends, family — anyone who’s accessible — and ask them to suggest an arti- cle, an adjective, and a noun. There’s your post title! Now write.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: The little things
writing_prompts.prompt: Describe a little thing — one of the things you love that defines your world but is often overlooked.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress
